If you want to allow your users to categorize their employment entries, create the categories below. This feature is useful if you want to list all of your users' employment entries. If you have no categories, your users will not be given the option of assigning an employment category.

These settings are applied on a per member level basis. Start by selecting the member level you want to modify, then adjust the settings for that level below.

column1: Do you want to let members view employment listings? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.
column2: Do you want to let members view employment listings? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: No, do not allow employment listings to be viewed.
column2: No, do not allow employment listings to be viewed.

column1: Yes, allow viewing of employment listings.
column2: Yes, allow viewing of employment listings.

column1: Yes, allow viewing of all employment listings, even private ones.
column2: Yes, allow viewing of all employment listings, even private ones.

column1: Do you want to let members edit employment listings? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.
column2: Do you want to let members edit employment listings? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: No, do not allow members to edit their employment listings.
column2: No, do not allow members to edit their employment listings.

column1: Yes, allow members to edit their own employment listings.
column2: Yes, allow members to edit their own employment listings.

column1: Yes, allow members to edit all employment listings.
column2: Yes, allow members to edit all employment listings.

column1: Do you want to let members delete employment listings? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.
column2: Do you want to let members delete employment listings? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: No, do not allow members to delete their employment listings.
column2: No, do not allow members to delete their employment listings.

column1: Yes, allow members to delete their own employment listings.
column2: Yes, allow members to delete their own employment listings.

column1: Yes, allow members to delete all employment listings.
column2: Yes, allow members to delete all employment listings.

column1: Yes, allow creation of employment listings.
column2: Yes, allow creation of employment listings.

column1: No, do not allow employment listings to be created.
column2: No, do not allow employment listings to be created.

column1: Do you want to let members upload photos to a employment listing? If set to no, the option to upload photos will not appear.
column2: Do you want to let members upload photos to a employment listing? If set to no, the option to upload photos will not appear.

column1: Yes, allow photo uploading to employment listings.
column2: Yes, allow photo uploading to employment listings.

column1: No, do not allow photo uploading.
column2: No, do not allow photo uploading.

column1: If you want to allow specific HTML tags, you can enter them below (separated by commas). Example: b, img, a, embed, font
column2: If you want to allow specific HTML tags, you can enter them below (separated by commas). Example: b, img, a, embed, font

Your members will be asked to provide some information about their employment listing when creating a new employment. Create some employment questions that allow them to describe their product in a way that relates to the theme of your community. To reorder the employment questions, click on their names and drag them up or down.

Do you want to let members create employment listings? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply. This is useful if you want members to be able to view employment listings, but only want certain levels to be able to create employment listings.

Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can see their employment listings. These options appear on your members' "Add Listings" and "Edit Entry" pages. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can post comments on their listings. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

column1: Enter the maximum number of allowed employment listings. The field must contain an integer between 1 and 999.
column2: Enter the maximum number of allowed employment listings. The field must contain an integer between 1 and 999.

column1: These settings affect all members in your community.
column2: These settings affect all members in your community.

Select whether or not you want to let the public (visitors that are not logged-in) to view the following sections of your social network. In some cases (such as Profiles, Blogs, and Albums), if you have given them the option, your users will be able to make their pages private even though you have made them publically viewable here. For more permissions settings, please visit the General Settings page.

column1: Yes, the public can view employment listings unless they are made private.
column2: Yes, the public can view employment listings unless they are made private.

column1: No, the public cannot view employment listings.
